title: 110_s1180
content: The Act titled "Workforce Housing Construction for the GO Zone Act of 2007" extends the placed-in-service date requirement for low-income housing credit buildings in the Gulf Opportunity Zone until 2010. It also addresses the preservation of previous low-income housing credit buildings in the same zone. The Act extends the placed-in-service date for low-income housing credit buildings in the Gulf Opportunity Zone until 2010. It addresses the preservation of qualified low-income buildings affected by Hurricanes Katrina and Rita, allowing owners to avoid recapture or loss of low-income housing credits. If a building in the Gulf Opportunity Zone qualifies for additional low-income housing credits and undergoes reconstruction, replacement, or rehabilitation within a specified timeframe, the qualified basis for determining the new credits will be the excess of the building's qualified basis at the end of the first taxable year of the credit period over the reconstruction costs. The text discusses the requirements for treatment as a separate new building in the Gulf Opportunity Zone for low-income housing credits after a disaster. It also addresses the time for making allocations of credits and the avoidance of recapture of credit for qualified low-income housing projects affected by a disaster in the Go Zone. SEC. 4 amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a credit for buildings acquired in the Katrina, Rita, and Wilma disaster areas. SEC. 5 includes the basis of property for mixed-income housing in the same disaster areas. Section 1400N(c) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the applicable fraction for mixed-income projects in designated disaster zones, allowing for a higher percentage of low-income housing units. The applicable fraction for low-income housing units in qualified projects is increased to one or 5 percent of total units or five percent of total floor space, depending on which adjustment provides the largest unit fraction. This applies to housing credit dollar amounts allocated after December 31, 2007, and buildings placed in service after that date. The applicable fraction for low-income housing units in qualified projects is increased to one or 5 percent of total units or five percent of total floor space, depending on which adjustment provides the largest unit fraction. This applies to housing credit dollar amounts allocated after December 31, 2007, and buildings placed in service after that date. The provision in section 42(h) does not apply to any building if paragraph (4) is the reason, but only for bonds issued after that date. SEC. 6 amends the Internal Revenue Code regarding over income loans for disaster areas, while SEC. 7 addresses Community Development Block Grants not affecting the determination of federally subsidized buildings. These changes apply to bonds issued after the enactment of the Act. Section 1400N(c) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to exclude community development block grants from being considered in determining if buildings are federally subsidized in certain disaster zones during a specific time period. The Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2006, also known as the Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act for Defense, the Global War on Terror, and Hurricane Recovery, 2006. SEC. 8. Application of special rules for low-income units in bond-financed projects under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for qualifying as a qualified residential rental project in specified zones. This section applies to bonds issued after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 9. Special tax-exempt bond financing rule for repairs and reconstructions of residences in the GO Zones. Section 1400N(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a special rule for repairs and reconstructions in the Gulf Opportunity Zone (GO Zone) areas affected by Hurricanes Katrina, Rita, and Wilma. Qualified repairs or reconstructions in these zones will be treated as qualified rehabilitations. The paragraph discusses the conditions for repair or reconstruction expenses to be considered as qualified rehabilitations in the Gulf Opportunity Zone areas affected by Hurricanes Katrina, Rita, and Wilma. The special rule applies to owner-financing provided after the enactment of the paragraph and before January 1, 2011.
